<Text: The Columns of Gediminas or Pillars of Gediminas are one of the earliest symbols of Lithuania and one of its historical coats of arms.>
Triplets:<The Columns of Gediminas
1:
<Text: Columns of Gediminas:  They were used in the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, initially as a rulers' personal insignia, a state symbol, and later as a part of heraldic signs of leading aristocracy.>
Triplets:<Columns of Gediminas
2: between World War I and World War II
